questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Consider the above reaction, the major product "P" formed is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statement : one is labelled as Assertion  A and the other is labelled as Reason R. 

Assertion A : SO2(g) is absorbed to a large extent than H2(g) on activated charcoal.

Reason R : SO2(g) has a higher critical temperature than H2(g).

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.

option_texts.A: Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.B: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.C: A is not correct but R is correct.
option_texts.D: A is correct but R is not correct.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The correct order of first ionisation enthalpy is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : Hyperconjugation is a permanent effect.

Statement II : Hyperconjugation in ethyl cation $$\left( {C{H_3} - \mathop C\limits^ +  {H_2}} \right)$$ involves the overlapping of $${C_{s{p^2}}} - {H_{1s}}$$ bond with empty 2p orbital of other carbon.

Choose the correct option :

option_texts.A: Both statement I and statement II are false
option_texts.B: Statement I is incorrect but statement II is true
option_texts.C: Statement I is correct but statement II is false
option_texts.D: Both statement I and statement II are true.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : $${[Mn{(CN)_6}]^{3 - }}$$, $${[Fe{(CN)_6}]^{3 - }}$$ and $${[Co{({C_2}{O_4})_3}]^{3 - }}$$ are d2sp3 hybridised.

Statement II : $${[MnCl)_6}{]^{3 - }}$$ and $${[Fe{F_6}]^{3 - }}$$ are paramagnetic and have 4 and 5 unpaired electrons, respectively.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Statement I is correct but statement II is false
option_texts.B: Both statement I and Statement II are false
option_texts.C: Statement I is incorrect but statement II is true
option_texts.D: Both statement I and statement II are true

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
To an aqueous solution containing ions such as Al3+, Zn2+, Ca2+, Fe3+, Ni2+, Ba2+ and Cu2+ was added conc. HCl, followed by H2S.

The total number of cations precipitated during this reaction is/are :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Compound A gives D-Galactose and D-Glucose on hydrolysis. The compound A is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
Chemistry
questions.question_text: Consider the above reaction, and choose the correct statement :

option_texts.A: The reaction is not possible in acidic medium
option_texts.B: Both compounds A and B are formed equally
option_texts.C: Compound A will be the major product
option_texts.D: Compound B will be the major product

.tg td{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg .tg-7btt{border-color:inherit;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-0pky{border-color:inherit;text-align:left;vertical-align:top}

(effect/affected species)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: What is A in the following reaction?

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The correct sequence of correct reagents for the following transformation is :

option_texts.A: (i) Fe, HCl(ii) Cl_{2}, HCl(iii) NaNO_{2}, HCl, 0$$^\circ$$C(iv) H_{2}O/H^{+}
option_texts.B: (i) Fe, HCl(ii) NaNO_{2}, HCl, 0$$^\circ$$C(iii) H_{2}O/H^{+}(iv) Cl_{2}, FeCl_{3}
option_texts.C: (i) Cl_{2}, FeCl_{3}(ii) Fe, HCl(iii) NaNO_{2}, HCl, 0$$^\circ$$C(iv) H_{2}O/H^{+}
option_texts.D: (i)  Cl_{2}, FeCl_{3}(ii) NaNO_{2}, HCl, 0$$^\circ$$C(iii) Fe, HCl(iv) H_{2}O/H^{+}

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The equilibrium constant for the reaction

A(s) $$\rightleftharpoons$$ M(s) + $${1 \over 2}$$O2(g)

is Kp = 4. At equilibrium, the partial pressure of O2 is _________ atm. (Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
When 400 mL of 0.2 M H2SO4 solution is mixed with 600 mL of 0.1 M NaOH solution, the increase in temperature of the final solution is __________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 K. (Round off to the nearest integer).

[Use : H+ (aq) + OH$$-$$ (aq) $$\to$$ H2O : $$\Delta$$$$\gamma$$H = $$-$$57.1 kJ mol$$-$$1]

Specific heat of H2O = 4.18 J K$$-$$1 g$$-$$1

density of H2O = 1.0 g cm$$-$$3

Assume no change in volume of solution on mixing.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
2SO2(g) + O2(g) $$\to$$ 2SO3(g)

The above reaction is carried out in a vessel starting with partial pressure PSO2 = 250 m bar, PO2 = 750 m bar and PSO3 = 0 bar. When the reaction is complete, the total pressure in the reaction vessel is _______ m bar. (Round off of the nearest integer).

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
10.0 mL of 0.05 M KMnO4 solution was consumed in a titration with 10.0 mL of given oxalic acid dihydrate solution. The strength of given oxalic acid solution is _________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 g/L.

(Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The total number of electrons in all bonding molecular orbitals of $$O_2^{2 - }$$ is ______________.

(Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
3 moles of metal complex with formula Co(en)2Cl3 gives 3 moles of silver chloride on treatment with excess of silver nitrate. The secondary valency of Co in the complex is ___________.

(Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
In a solvent 50% of an acid HA dimerizes and the rest dissociates. The van't Hoff factor of the acid is __________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2.

(Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The dihedral angle in staggered form of Newman projection of 1, 1, 1-Trichloro ethane is ___________ degree. (Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
For the first order reaction A $$\to$$ 2B, 1 mole of reactant A gives 0.2 moles of B after 100 minutes. The half life of the reaction is __________ min. (Round off to the nearest integer).

[Use : ln 2 = 0.69, ln 10 = 2.3]

Properties of logarithms : ln xy = y ln x;

$$\ln \left( {{x \over y}} \right) = \ln x - \ln y$$

(Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
For the cell

Cu(s) | Cu2+ (aq) (0.1 M) || Ag+(aq) (0.01 M) | Ag(s)

the cell potential E1 = 0.3095 V

For the cell

Cu(s) | Cu2+ (aq) (0.01 M) || Ag+(aq) (0.001 M) | Ag(s)

the cell potential = ____________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 V. (Round off the nearest integer).

[Use : $${{2.303RT} \over F}$$ = 0.059]

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
The point P (a, b) undergoes the following three transformations successively :

(a) reflection about the line y = x.

(b) translation through 2 units along the positive direction of x-axis.

(c) rotation through angle $${\pi  \over 4}$$ about the origin in the anti-clockwise direction.

If the co-ordinates of the final position of the point P are $$\left( { - {1 \over {\sqrt 2 }},{7 \over {\sqrt 2 }}} \right)$$, then the value of 2a + b is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: A possible value of 'x', for which the ninth term in the expansion of $${\left\{ {{3^{{{\log }_3}\sqrt {{{25}^{x - 1}} + 7} }} + {3^{\left( { - {1 \over 8}} \right){{\log }_3}({5^{x - 1}} + 1)}}} \right\}^{10}}$$ in the increasing powers of $${3^{\left( { - {1 \over 8}} \right){{\log }_3}({5^{x - 1}} + 1)}}$$ is equal to 180, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let f : R $$\to$$ R be defined as $$f(x + y) + f(x - y) = 2f(x)f(y),f\left( {{1 \over 2}} \right) =  - 1$$. Then, the value of $$\sum\limits_{k = 1}^{20} {{1 \over {\sin (k)\sin (k + f(k))}}} $$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let C be the set of all complex numbers. Let

S1 = {z$$\in$$C : |z $$-$$ 2| $$\le$$ 1} and 

S2 = {z$$\in$$C : z(1 + i) + $$\overline z $$(1 $$-$$ i) $$\ge$$ 4}.

Then, the maximum value of $${\left| {z - {5 \over 2}} \right|^2}$$ for z$$\in$$S1 $$\cap$$ S2 is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $$\tan \left( {{\pi  \over 9}} \right),x,\tan \left( {{{7\pi } \over {18}}} \right)$$ are in arithmetic progression and $$\tan \left( {{\pi  \over 9}} \right),y,\tan \left( {{{5\pi } \over {18}}} \right)$$ are also in arithmetic progression, then $$|x - 2y|$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text: The area of the region bounded by y $$-$$ x = 2 and x2 = y is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let y = y(x) be the solution of the differential 

equation (x $$-$$ x3)dy = (y + yx2 $$-$$ 3x4)dx, x > 2. If y(3) = 3, then y(4) is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
The value of 

$$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to 0} \left( {{x \over {\root 8 \of {1 - \sin x}  - \root 8 \of {1 + \sin x} }}} \right)$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Two sides of a parallelogram are along the lines 4x + 5y = 0 and 7x + 2y = 0. If the equation of one of the diagonals of the parallelogram is 11x + 7y = 9, then other diagonal passes through the point :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$\alpha  = \mathop {\max }\limits_{x \in R} \{ {8^{2\sin 3x}}{.4^{4\cos 3x}}\} $$ and $$\beta  = \mathop {\min }\limits_{x \in R} \{ {8^{2\sin 3x}}{.4^{4\cos 3x}}\} $$. If $$8{x^2} + bx + c = 0$$ is a quadratic equation whose roots are $$\alpha$$1/5 and $$\beta$$1/5, then the value of c $$-$$ b is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics

option_texts.A: f is continuous everywhere but not differentiable exactly at one point in (0, $$\infty$$)
option_texts.C: f is not continuous exactly at two points in (0, $$\infty$$)
option_texts.D: f is continuous everywhere but not differentiable exactly at two points in (0, $$\infty$$)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let N be the set of natural numbers and a relation R on N be defined by $$R = \{ (x,y) \in N \times N:{x^3} - 3{x^2}y - x{y^2} + 3{y^3} = 0\} $$. Then the relation R is :

option_texts.A: symmetric but neither reflexive nor transitive
option_texts.B: reflexive but neither symmetric nor transitive
option_texts.C: reflexive and symmetric, but not transitive

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Consider a circle C which touches the y-axis at (0, 6) and cuts off an intercept $$6\sqrt 5 $$ on the x-axis. Then the radius of the circle C is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let f : (a, b) $$\to$$ R be twice differentiable function such that $$f(x) = \int_a^x {g(t)dt} $$ for a differentiable function g(x). If f(x) = 0 has exactly five distinct roots in (a, b), then g(x)g'(x) = 0 has at least :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If the real part of the complex number $$z = {{3 + 2i\cos \theta } \over {1 - 3i\cos \theta }},\theta  \in \left( {0,{\pi  \over 2}} \right)$$ is zero, then the value of sin23$$\theta$$ + cos2$$\theta$$ is equal to _______________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $$\int_0^\pi  {({{\sin }^3}x){e^{ - {{\sin }^2}x}}dx = \alpha  - {\beta  \over e}\int_0^1 {\sqrt t {e^t}dt} } $$, then $$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$ is equal to ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of real roots of the equation e4x $$-$$ e3x $$-$$ 4e2x $$-$$ ex + 1 = 0 is equal to ______________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let y = y(x) be the solution of the differential equation dy = e$$\alpha$$x + y dx; $$\alpha$$ $$\in$$ N. If y(loge2) = loge2 and y(0) = loge$$\left( {{1 \over 2}} \right)$$, then the value of $$\alpha$$ is equal to _____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let n be a non-negative integer. Then the number of divisors of the form "4n + 1" of the number (10)10 . (11)11 . (13)13 is equal to __________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let A = {n $$\in$$ N | n2 $$\le$$ n + 10,000}, B = {3k + 1 | k$$\in$$ N} an dC = {2k | k$$\in$$N}, then the sum of all the elements of the set A $$\cap$$(B $$-$$ C) is equal to _____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
Physics
questions.question_text: An electron and proton are separated by a large distance. The electron starts approaching the proton with energy 3 eV. The proton captures the electron and forms a hydrogen atom in second excited state. The resulting photon is incident on a photosensitive metal of threshold wavelength 4000$$\mathop A\limits^o $$. What is the maximum kinetic energy of the emitted photoelectron?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The expected graphical representation of the variation of angle of deviation '$$\delta$$' with angle of incidence 'i' in a prism is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A raindrop with radius R = 0.2 mm falls from a cloud at a height h = 2000 m above the ground. Assume that the drop is spherical throughout its fall and the force of buoyance may be neglected, then the terminal speed attained by the raindrop is :

[Density of water fw = 1000 kg m$$-$$3 and Density of air fa = 1.2 kg m$$-$$3, g = 10 m/s2, Coefficient of viscosity of air = 1.8 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$5 Nsm$$-$$2]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: One mole of an ideal gas is taken through an adiabatic process where the temperature rises from 27$$^\circ$$ C to 37$$^\circ$$ C. If the ideal gas is composed of polyatomic molecule that has 4 vibrational modes, which of the following is true? [R = 8.314 J mol$$-$$1 k$$-$$1]

option_texts.A: work done by the gas is close to 332 J
option_texts.B: work done on the gas is close to 582 J
option_texts.C: work done by the gas is close to 582 J
option_texts.D: work done on the gas is close to 332 J

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An object of mass 0.5 kg is executing simple harmonic motion. It amplitude is 5 cm and time period (T) is 0.2 s. What will be the potential energy of the object at an instant $$t = {T \over 4}s$$ starting from mean position. Assume that the initial phase of the oscillation is zero.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Match List I with List II.



  
    
    List - I
    
    List - II
  


  
    (a)
    Capacitance, C
    (i)
    $${M^1}{L^1}{T^{ - 3}}{A^{ - 1}}$$
  
  
    (b)
    Permittivity of free space, $${\varepsilon _0}$$
    (ii)
    $${M^{ - 1}}{L^{ - 3}}{T^4}{A^2}$$
  
  
    (c)
    Permeability of free space, $${\mu _0}$$
    (iii)
    $${M^{ - 1}}{L^{ - 2}}{T^4}{A^2}$$
  
  
    (d)
    Electric field, E
    (iv)
    $${M^1}{L^1}{T^{ - 2}}{A^{ - 2}}$$
  



Choose the correct answer from the options given below

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below is the plot of a potential energy function U(x) for a system, in which a particle is in one dimensional motion, while a conservative force F(x) acts on it. Suppose that Emech = 8 J, the incorrect statement for this system is :



[ where K.E. = kinetic energy ]

option_texts.A: at x > x_{4} K.E. is constant throughout the region.
option_texts.B: at x < x_{1}, K.E. is smallest and the particle is moving at the slowest speed.
option_texts.C: at x = x_{2}, K.E. is greatest and the particle is moving at the fastest speed.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A 100$$\Omega$$ resistance, a 0.1 $$\mu$$F capacitor and an inductor are connected in series across a 250 V supply at variable frequency. Calculate the value of inductance of inductor at which resonance will occur. Given that the resonant frequency is 60 Hz.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A simple pendulum of mass 'm', length 'l' and charge '+ q' suspended in the electric field produced by two conducting parallel plates as shown. The value of deflection of pendulum in equilibrium position will be

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Find the truth table for the function Y of A and B represented in the following figure.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Figure A and B shown to long straight wires of circular cross-section (a and b with a < b), carrying current I which is uniformly distributed across the cross-section. The magnitude of magnetic field B varies with radius r and can be represented as :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two identical particles of mass 1 kg each go round a circle of radius R, under the action of their mutual gravitational attraction. The angular speed of each particle is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What will be the magnitude of electric field at point O as shown in the figure? Each side of the figure is l and perpendicular to each other?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A physical quantity 'y' is represented by the formula $$y = {m^2}{r^{ - 4}}{g^x}{l^{ - {3 \over 2}}}$$

If the percentage errors found in y, m, r, l and g are 18, 1, 0.5, 4 and p respectively, then find the value of x and p.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An automobile of mass 'm' accelerates starting from origin and initially at rest, while the engine supplies constant power P. The position is given as a function of time by :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
The planet Mars has two moons, if one of them has a period 7 hours, 30 minutes and an orbital radius of 9.0 $$\times$$ 103 km. Find the mass of Mars.

$$\left\{ {Given\,{{4{\pi ^2}} \over G} = 6 \times {{10}^{11}}{N^{ - 1}}{m^{ - 2}}k{g^2}} \right\}$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A particle of mass M originally at rest is subjected to a force whose direction is constant but magnitude varies with time according to the relation 

$$F = {F_0}\left[ {1 - {{\left( {{{t - T} \over T}} \right)}^2}} \right]$$

Where F0 and T are constants. The force acts only for the time interval 2T. The velocity v of the particle after time 2T is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The resistance of a conductor at 15$$^\circ$$C is 16$$\Omega$$ and at 100$$^\circ$$C is 20$$\Omega$$. What will be the temperature coefficient of resistance of the conductor?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In the given figure, two wheels P and Q are connected by a belt B. The radius of P is three times as that of Q. In case of same rotational kinetic energy, the ratio of rotational inertias $$\left( {{{{I_1}} \over {{I_2}}}} \right)$$ will be x : 1. The value of x will be _____________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The difference in the number of waves when yellow light propagates through air and vacuum columns of the same thickness is one. The thickness of the air column is ___________ mm. [Refractive index of air = 1.0003, wavelength of yellow light in vacuum = 6000 $$\mathop A\limits^o $$]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
In the given figure the magnetic flux through the loop increases according to the relation $$\phi$$B(t) = 10t2 + 20t, where $$\phi$$B is in milliwebers and t is in seconds. 

The magnitude of current through R  = 2$$\Omega$$ resistor at t = 5 s is ___________ mA.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A particle executes simple harmonic motion represented by displacement function as 

x(t) = A sin($$\omega$$t + $$\phi$$)

If the position and velocity of the particle at t = 0 s are 2 cm and 2$$\omega$$ cm s$$-$$1 respectively, then its amplitude is $$x\sqrt 2 $$ cm where the value of x is _________________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A swimmer wants to cross a river from point A to point B. Line AB makes an angle of 30$$^\circ$$ with the flow of river. Magnitude of velocity of the swimmer is same as that of the river. The angle $$\theta$$ with the line AB should be _________$$^\circ$$, so that the swimmer reaches point B.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
For the circuit shown, the value of current at time t = 3.2 s will be _________ A.


[Voltage distribution V(t) is shown by Fig. (1) and the circuit is shown in Fig. (2)]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A small block slides down from the top of hemisphere of radius R = 3 m as shown in the figure. The height 'h' at which the block will lose contact with the surface of the sphere is __________ m.

(Assume there is no friction between the block and the hemisphere)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
The K$$\alpha$$ X-ray of molybdenum has wavelength 0.071 nm. If the energy of a molybdenum atoms with a K electron knocked out is 27.5 keV, the energy of this atom when an L electron is knocked out will be __________ keV. (Round off to the nearest integer)

[h = 4.14 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$15 eVs, c = 3 $$\times$$ 108 ms$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The water is filled upto height of 12 m in a tank having vertical sidewalls. A hole is made in one of the walls at a depth 'h' below the water level. The value of 'h' for which the emerging steam of water strikes the ground at the maximum range is ________ m.
